title: District 115 Board of Education has started the process to fire Albert Macius, a tenured math teacher Lake Forester
text:
The Board of Education for Lake Forest District 115 has started proceedings to fire a math teacher facing misdemeanor charges.
The six present members of the board voted unanimously the evening of Oct. 13 to start proceedings to terminate Albert Macius, 64, a tenured teacher at Lake Forest High School.
According to Title 23 of the Illinois Administrative Code, Macius has 17 days to request a hearing after receiving a "bill of particulars" or charges from District 115. Macius can participate in the process to select a hearing officer. The hearing is closed to the public unless either Macius or District 115 wants it open to the public and the hearing officer agrees. The hearing has to start within 75 days and conclude within 120 days after the appointment of the hearing officer. Post-hearing briefs must be submitted within 21 days of the conclusion of the hearing.
A student reported that on May 11 a math teacher had come to her home and made "inappropriate physical contact" with her according to previous Chicago Tribune articles. The Lake County News Sun reported police said Macius allegedly kissed the student on the neck and rubbed her leg without her consent.
Macius was charged with two misdemeanor counts of battery on July 20 according to the Lake County Clerk of the Circuit Court website. He pleaded not guilty on Aug. 3, said Cynthia Vargas of the Lake County State's Attorney's office. His next hearing is scheduled for Oct. 29.
Both counts are punishable by up to one year in county jail – to be served concurrently – and/or a fine of up to $2,500 according to a July interview with Michael Ori, chief of traffic, misdemeanor and felony traffic at the State's Attorney office.
The Lake Forester was unable to contact Macius. His attorney, Thomas Breen, did not return calls by deadline.
